intro: Galium nevadense, commonly known as Nevada bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, and it produces tiny, bead-like fruits. Galium nevadense is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants.
